result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared Radandt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, and any week that is not accomplished defendant must complete 10 hours of community service.

Completion of SAFE program.
Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
*AMENDED-D.O.B.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree

State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person with Atty Dan Cveykus.

State moves to:
14CF565>>D&RI entire file

14CF563 - Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on both counts; 2 years probation on each count, concurrent
CONDITIONS: Completion of Safe program; CC inluding 2 D.A. surcharges; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, and any week that is not accomplished, defendant must complete 10 hrs c.s per week.

Atty Cveykus notes defendant would like to petition for expungement at the successful completion of probation; State notes if defendant petitions for expungement, State will object; COURT notes if all conditions met, defendant may petition court for expungement, and State will be free to argue against that petition.

COURT AMENDS Bond and vacates no contact provision with victim in both cases; remainder of bond and conditions remains intact.

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 14CF565, 14CF563.  No contact with victim(s):  N.L.  (NON-WAIVABLE)   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort through Marathon Co. SD to retrieve any personal belongings.  Third party visitation through Family Resource Center.
